title: Michelle Visage near tears as she receives highest Strictly 2019 score
text:
Strictly Come Dancing’s Michelle Visage was near tears (Picture: BBC)

Michelle Visage has received the highest score of the 2019 series of Strictly Come Dancing series after the judges’ handed her a 39.

Michelle and professional partner Giovanni Pernice danced the foxtrot to Addams’ Family Values and Shirley Ballas, Motsi Mabuse and Bruno Tonioli all handed the pair a score of 10.

Craig Revel-Horwood gave the pair a nine.

It was the highest score of the 2019 series so far; Karim and Amy, and Saffron and AJ had both previously received scores of 38.

The score also came a week after their lowest score of the series.

The score came a week after their lowest score of the series (Picture: BBC)

‘You’re in tears,’ Claudia said as the scores were unveiled, before Michelle thanked Gio for his hard work.

Michelle, who is also a Ru Paul’s Drag Race judge, has been out there doing the absolute most to take the UK by storm.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And deservedly so.

Not only has she previously appeared on the UK version of Celebrity Big Brother, coming in fifth in 2015, but she’s also currently dancing her heart out on Strictly and appearing as a judge on RuPaul’s Drag Race UK every week.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday night on BBC One.
